tuv.seg: Witnesses in Ireland are people who have been called to give evidence in court
Daoine iad ar iarradh orthu fianaise a thabhairt i gcúirt is ea finnéithe
The witness's name is called and they go into the witness box at one side of the judge
Fograítear ainm an fhinné agus téann sé nó sí isteach i gclár na mionn atá ar thaobh amháin den bhreitheamh
They stand in the witness box to repeat the oath or affirmation and then sit down
Seasfaidh sé nó sí i mbosca na mionn chun mionn nó dearbhascadh a athrá agus ansin suífidh sé nó sí síos
The witness is then asked a series of questions by the barristers (or solicitors) in the case
Cuirfidh na habhcóidí (nó na aturnaetha) sa chás sraith de cheisteanna ansin ar an bhfinné
The witness's function is to give evidence to the court
Is í feidhm an fhinné fianaise a thabhairt don chúirt
For example, the witness may have seen a robbery take place and may be able to tell the court what they saw
Mar shampla, b'fhéidir go bhfaca an finné robáil ag tarlú agus b'fhéidir go mbeadh sé/sí in ann a rá leis an gcúirt céard a chonaic sé/sí
This evidence may help the judge or the jury to make its decision
D'fhéadfadh an fhianaise seo cabhrú leis an mbreitheamh nó leis an ngiúiré cinneadh a dhéanamh
Further information about being a witness in a court case in Ireland is available in our section on Witnesses
Chun tuilleadh eolais a fháil ar bheith i do fhinné i gcás, brú ar Finnéithe
